attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current:
I am incredibly slow to trust. Those who seem the fairest often have the most to hide. 

I will often smoke Cigars when stressed, which is often nowadays.

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: Freedom whatever the cost. Chains from both knowledge and will are meant to be broken, as are those who would forge them.

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current: I hold my family dear to my heart, they were taken from me and to my knowledge are dead. For that I will never forgive myself, but my people still need me, and I will avenge them!

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current: I will do whatever it takes to free my people from tyranny - collaborators are worse than the tyrants they cower behind.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MQn1cpul0JbVleV9ZfW_description
attribs.current:
You've learned how to invest a spark of magic into mundane objects. To use this ability, you must have thieves' tools or artisan's tools in hand. You then touch a Tiny nonmagical object as an action and give it one of the following magical properties of your choice:

The object sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

Whenever tapped by a creature, the object emits a recorded message that can be heard up to 10 feet away. You utter the message when you bestow this property on the object, and the recording can be no more than 6 seconds long.

The object continuously emits your choice of an odor or a nonverbal sound (wind, waves, chirping, or the like). The chosen phenomenon is perceivable up to 10 feet away.

A static visual effect appears on one of the object's surfaces. This effect can be a picture, up to 25 words of text, lines and shapes, or a mixture of these elements, as you like.

The chosen property lasts indefinitely. As an action, you can touch the object and end the property early.

You can bestow magic on multiple objects, touching one object each time you use this feature, though a single object can only bear one property at a time. The maximum number of objects you can affect with this feature at one time is equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one object). If you try to exceed your maximum, the oldest property immediately ends, and then the new property applies.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MQn1cpul0JbVleV9ZfX_description
attribs.current:
You've studied the workings of magic and how to cast spells, channelling the magic through objects. To observers, you don't appear to be casting spells in a conventional way; you appear to produce wonders from mundane items and outlandish inventions.

Tools Required
You produce your artificer spell effects through your tools. You must have a spellcasting focus—specifically thieves' tools or some kind of artisan's tool—in hand when you cast any spell with this Spellcasting feature (meaning the spell has an "M" component when you cast it). You must be proficient with the tool to use it in this way. See the equipment chapter in the Player's Handbook for descriptions of these tools.

After you gain the Infuse Item feature at 2nd level, you can also use any item bearing one of your infusions as a spellcasting focus.
Cantrips (0-Level Spells)
You know two cantrips of your choice from the artificer spell list. At higher levels, you learn additional artificer cantrips of your choice, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Artificer table.

When you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the artificer cantrips you know with another cantrip from the artificer spell list.
Preparing and Casting Spells
The Artificer table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your artificer spells. To cast one of your artificer spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of artificer spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the artificer spell list. When you do so, choose a number of artificer spells equal to your Intelligence modifier + half your artificer level, rounded down (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 5th-level artificer, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With an Intelligence of 14, your list of prepared spells can include four spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell cure wounds, you can cast it using a 1st-level or a 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of artificer spells requires time spent tinkering with your spellcasting focuses: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

Spellcasting Ability
Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your artificer spells; your understanding of the theory behind magic allows you to wield these spells with superior skill. You use your Intelligence whenever an artificer spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for an artificer spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier

Ritual Casting
You can cast an artificer spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MQn1cpvEOiEZWGAw5Zt_description
attribs.current: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MQn1cpvEOiEZWGAw5Zu_description
attribs.current: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MQn1cpvEOiEZWGAw5Zx_description
attribs.current: Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices, you can add twice your proficiency bonus, instead of any proficiency bonus you normally apply.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MQn1cpvEOiEZWGAw5Zy_description
attribs.current:
You have proficiency with artisan’s tools (tinker’s tools). Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp).

The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time.

When you create a device, choose one of the following options:

Clockwork Toy: This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of your turns in a random direction. 

It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.
Fire Starter: The device produces a miniature flame, which you can use to light a Candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires your action.

Music Box: When opened, this music box plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song’s end or when it is closed.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MQn1cpxVh6JYZMws2fr_itemcontent
attribs.current: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MQn1cpxVh6JYZMws2fs_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon (see "Improvised Weapons" later in the section). A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MQn1cpxVh6JYZMws2ft_itemcontent
attribs.current: Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MQn1cpxVh6JYZMws2fu_itemcontent
attribs.current: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MQn1cpxVh6JYZMws2fw_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: A short piece of copper wire

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MQn1cpxVh6JYZMws2fw_spelldescription
attribs.current: You point your finger toward a creature within range and whisper a message. The target (and only the target) hears the message and can reply in a whisper that only you can hear. You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target and know it is beyond the barrier. Magical silence, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood blocks the spell. The spell doesn’t have to follow a straight line and can travel freely around corners or through openings.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MQn1cpzInIGwT3YxST2_spelldescription
attribs.current: You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends or until you use your action to dismiss it. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear thin, fat, or in between. You can’t change your body type, so you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you. The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing or would feel your head and hair. If you use this spell to appear thinner than you are, the hand of someone who reaches out to touch you would bump into you while it was seemingly still in midair. To discern that you are disguised, a creature can use its action to inspect your appearance and must succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MQn1cpzInIGwT3YxST4_spelldescription
attribs.current: Each object in a 20-foot cube within range is outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Any creature in the area when the spell is cast is also outlined in light if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed dim light in a 10-foot radius. Any attack roll against an affected creature or object has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature or object can’t benefit from being invisible.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MQn1cpzInIGwT3YxST4_spelltarget
attribs.current: Each object in a 20-foot cube within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MQn1cpzInIGwT3YxST7_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MQn1cpzInIGwT3YxST7_spellcastingtime
attribs.current: 1 reaction, which you take when you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MQn1cpzInIGwT3YxST7_spelldescription
attribs.current: The spell captures some of the incoming energy, lessening its effect on you and storing it for your next melee attack. You have resistance to the triggering damage type until the start of your next turn. Also, the first time you hit with a melee attack on your next turn, the target takes an extra 1d6 damage of the triggering type, and the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MQn1cq-RV8kP0ZmnBQT_itemcontent
attribs.current: A backpack can hold one cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MQn1cq-RV8kP0ZmnBQX_itemcontent
attribs.current: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MQn1cq-RV8kP0ZmnBQX_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Adventuring Gear, Damage: 1, Damage Type: Fire, Range: 20/40

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MQn1cq-RV8kP0ZmnBQY_itemcontent
attribs.current: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch - or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel - takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MQn1cq-RV8kP0ZmnBQZ_itemcontent
attribs.current: A waterskin can hold up to 4 pints of liquid.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MQn1cq-RV8kP0ZmnBQa_itemcontent
attribs.current: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MQo0m5IJwoEJd9BOa2i_itemcontent
attribs.current:
This is purely a proof of concept, but if this works it could change the course of history for our people... We will finally be able to rise up against that tyrant Torigg and his brutes - then after they beg for mercy we will crush them and restore Clockenheim to its former glory!

Oops got a bit side-tracked there: where was I?

Project Netheril
Description: A weapon with great theoretical power, it is akin to a crossbow in scale but heavier due to its ammunition (more on that later). It has two barrels which allows it to fire concentrated rounds at the target, obliterating all biological matter that it encounters.
Our team tried to add more barrels but unfortunately the weapon tends to overheat and even caused several deaths due to the prototypes ammunition exploding during training exercises.
Ammunition: “Energy Cell”
Description: This is a new form of ammunition created by yours truly, this allows the user to concentrate the chemicals into an isolated chamber, this will then be channelled through the firearm and propelled toward the target.
Type: Anti-Matter (Necrotic)
This type of ammo is a special concoction that I discovered while overseeing a mining operation in a [REDACTED] Korevian cave system. The deposits of metal found there could be enriched to augment their properties to lethal affect. The outcome will severely injure the target or reduce them to their component atoms.

Components:
Weapon – Modular Metal Casing with Passive Ventilation System, Dark Wooden Grip, Energy Modulator
Ammo – Clockenheim Mk2 Glass (Or any glass that is approved to contain highly volatile magic), Titanium Alloy Casing with Refill/Loading Nozzle, [REDACTED] Isotope (or any other form of concentrated magic)

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MQoHhmGMthQM38F1RMo_itemcontent
attribs.current:
This is purely a proof of concept, but if this works it could change the course of history for our people... We will finally be able to rise up against that tyrant Torigg and his brutes - then after they beg for mercy we will crush them and restore Clockenheim to its former glory!

Oops got a bit side-tracked there: where was I?

Project Netheril
Description: A weapon with great theoretical power, it is akin to a crossbow in scale but heavier due to its ammunition (more on that later). It has two barrels which allows it to fire concentrated rounds at the target, obliterating all biological matter that it encounters.
Our team tried to add more barrels but unfortunately the weapon tends to overheat and even caused several deaths due to the prototype’s ammunition exploding during training exercises.
Ammunition: “Energy Cell”
Description: This is a new form of ammunition created by yours truly, this allows the user to concentrate the chemicals into an isolated chamber, this will then be channelled through the firearm and propelled toward the target.
Type: Anti-Matter (Necrotic)
This type of ammo is a special concoction that I discovered while overseeing a mining operation in a [REDACTED] Korevian cave system. The deposits of metal found there could be enriched to augment their properties to lethal affect. The outcome will severely injure the target or reduce them to their component atoms.
The cell is depleted upon use due to excess heat.
Components:
Weapon – Modular Metal Casing with Passive Ventilation System, Firing mechanism with springs and cogs, Dark Wooden Grip, Particle Accelerator
Ammo – Clockenheim Mk2 Glass (Or any glass that is approved to contain highly volatile magic), Titanium Alloy Casing with Loading Nozzle, [REDACTED] Isotope (or any other form of concentrated magic).

attribs.name: character_backstory
attribs.current:
I always knew that it was just a matter of time before my revolution would catch up to me eventually, little did I know that the price of freedom would cost me more dearly than I could ever bargained for...

I was born and raised in Clockenheim, during my childhood I heard many tales of this land being a tinkerer's paradise where the arcane and the sciences intertwined freely. This was our homeland or at least it was until the tyrannical Dwarven empire got scared of our creations and saw fit to rob us of our birth-right!

Many Gnomes grew to respect their captors, collaborating with the swines that held us tightly. But there were some likeminded Gnomes that wanted to free our nation, and become independent once more, so I founded our group of freedom fighters that mostly ran clandestine operations to give us an edge over our enemy.

This is where I met my wife and ultimately brought a new life into this world, my son Alaek.

I wasn't just a leader, but an inventor as well, I led the research and development of ordinance that would assist my brethren in the fight against the Dwarven oppressors.

My primary goal was one of deterrence, I never wished for innocent blood to be spilt in my name and to do that we had to show our strength to the world.

It was then that I constructed my first firearm named after the Gnomish God Gaerdal Ironhand - which seemed fitting for the battles we were fighting. Instead of metallic ball rounds, this used concentrated energy loaded into Energy cells firing a beam of hurt at the unfortunate target.

Gnomes that are born in Clockenheim are restricted from leaving, but we managed to craft tunnels under their noses, to slip in and out when we needed any supplies considered "contraband". It was while overseeing a mining expedition in a Korevian cave system located ██████████ where we found the first part of our deterrence in the form of a metal. The deposits of metal found there could be enriched to augment their properties to lethal affect.

The outcome would severely injure the target or reduce them to their component atoms.

That is where Project Netheril started, a weapon that if mass produced throughout Clockenheim's rebel army would shake the foundations of the Korevian empire.

We made prototypes: many catastrophic failures but more opportunities to ever improve the design.

It took two years but after a lot of hard work, and failed raids by the Dwarfs I finally did it and with it our people could finally be free."

"It wasn't long after that our new HQ was raided by the Korevian Forces. This made no sense, no one could have known that we were there! Unless? There must have been a mole in our midst!

These men were professionals they weren’t the usually brutes that Dwarfs count as infantry, they were going room to room killing everyone, all the while shouting at each other that they needed me alive.

It was then I knew what they meant: they wanted the weapon or at least the blueprints, and would do anything to get it. I rushed to my lab and triggered the weapon to charge indefinitely until it ultimately combusted in a ball of antimatter destroying the lab.

Before that happened I gathered the blueprints, my pistol – fully loaded, with two of the only Energy cells left in Clockenheim (couldn’t risk them using this instead). Then I rushed to my family to get them out of the city, but the bastards got to them first, they knew where they were and were taking them away for torture or worse. I couldn’t stop them without dooming our homeland if the technology fell into their hands…

I will make them pay for what they have done - for that I can be certain no one harms my family!

I sent a message to my trusted contact that specialised in smuggling, she gave me a new identity of my choosing, it was then she cast a spell, and all went to black.

Dying was the only way out of Clockenheim...

So I died.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MQt2LDOzTgZ3OIhphwO_itemcontent
attribs.current: Wondrous item, common  This item replaces a lost limb—a hand, an arm, a foot, a leg, or a similar body part. While the prosthetic is attached, it functions identically to the part it replaces. You can detach or reattach it as an action, and it can't be removed against your will. It detaches if you die.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MQt2LDOzTgZ3OIhphwO_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Wondrous item,Damage Type: Bludgeoning, Attacks: 1, Attacks: 1, Attacks: 1, Attacks: 1, Attacks: 1, Attacks: 1, Attacks: 1, Attacks: 1, Attacks: 1, Attacks: 1, Attacks: 1, Attacks: 1, Attacks: 1, Attacks: 1, Attacks: 1, Attacks: 1, Attacks: 1, Attacks: 1, Attacks: 1,Damage: 1

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MQy7npwhEt965aKlgHs_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Ammunition. The Ammunition of a firearm is destroyed upon use. Futuristic firearms are powered by a Special type of Ammunition called energy cells. An Energy cell contains enough power for all the shots its firearm can make.

You can use a weapon that has the Ammunition property to make a ranged Attack only if you have Ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you Attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of Ammunition. Drawing the Ammunition from a Quiver, case, or other container is part of the Attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). 

Reload. A limited number of shots can be made with a weapon that has the reload property. A character must then reload it using an action or a Bonus Action (the character's choice).

attribs.name: character_appearance
attribs.current:
Alston is a middle aged Rock Gnome at 3'4". He is black of hair and beard.

Most notable thing about Alston's appearance is his hand-made prosthetic arm that has a slight ticking like a clock, this seemingly functions the same why as a normal arm.

To improve his aim he also wears a modified monocle that glows a radiant green when it is in use.

Lastly you can usually find him smoking his trusty cigars, especially when stressed.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MSOubVvyUyZZ2w-dqU6_spelldescription
attribs.current: Lightning springs from your hand to deliver a shock to a creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is wearing armor made of metal. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 lightning damage, and it can’t take reactions until the start of its next turn.   ​The spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MSOubVvyUyZZ2w-dqU6_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature you try to touch

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MSP6wwC10ZPgXYMJn5d_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the Healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MSP6wwC10ZPgXYMJn5d_spelldescription
attribs.current: A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MSP70Fh4I6zOpUsLpKj_spelldescription
attribs.current: For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any. The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

attribs.name: allies_and_organizations
attribs.current:
Organisations: 
    L Vanguards of Clockenheim - Leader and Chief Weapon's Engineer 
       (Considered a Terrorist Cell in Korevia and most parts of the civilised world 
       as a whole - mostly to keep the peace with the Dwarven kingdoms).

Family: 
    L Zanna - Wife and Spy (thought to be murdered during the raid)  
    L Alaek - Son (thought to be murdered during the raid)

Allies:

attribs.name: additional_feature_and_traits
attribs.current:
Fake Identity:
  Assumed Identity - Alaek
  Real Name - Alston Maekkelferce

Weapon Progression - 

    LV 1 - 1d6 Rad L Pistol
    LV 5 - 2d6 Rad L Pistol
    LV 10 - 3d6 Rad L Pistol
    LV 15 - Laser Rifle
    LV 20 - Antimatter Rifle

Racial Traits - 
    INT +2
    CON +1

Proposed Feats - 
    Gunner
    Sharpshooter
    Inspiring Leader
    Observant
    Alert
    Linguist

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MSZRSSeWKBshTcJJ6T6_itemcontent
attribs.current: Ammunition. The ammunition of a firearm is destroyed upon use. Futuristic firearms are powered by a special type of ammunition called energy cells. An energy cell contains enough power for all the shots its firearm can make.  You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon).   Reload. A limited number of shots can be made with a weapon that has the reload property. A character must then reload it using an action or a bonus action (the character's choice).  Two-Handed. This weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-McaHC5o1i3XgFtYZZKx_description
attribs.current: As the leader of the "Vanguards of Clockenheim", you have access to a Secret network of supporters and operatives who can provide assistance on your Adventures. You know a set of Secret signs and passwords you can use to Identify such operatives, who can provide you with access to a hidden Safe House, free room and board, or assistance in finding information. Despite being the leader of the faction agents may not always be willing to risk their lives or risk revealing their true identities.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Mcaz25dwojJvEalxK2k_itemcontent
attribs.current: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Mcazsj3yr-FFclaZVwR_itemcontent
attribs.current: **Holy Symbol**: A holy symbol is a representation of a god or pantheon. It might be an amulet depicting a symbol representing a deity, the same symbol carefully engraved or inlaid as an emblem on a shield, or a tiny box holding a fragment of a sacred relic. Pantheons lists the symbols commonly associated with many gods in the multiverse. A cleric or paladin can use a holy symbol as a spellcasting focus. To use the symbol in this way, the caster must hold it in hand, wear it visibly, or bear it on a shield.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Mcb3qT4AnPrks7r8lI-_itemcontent
attribs.current: Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MfPiVtZ3YICBZvypWRu_description
attribs.current:
You are the leader of freedom fighters that fight for the freedom of all Gnomes in Clockenheim, and to rightfully be recognised as an independent country free from Dwarven tyranny. 

Members range from all facets of the community as unlike more unhinged cells you don't resort to such barbaric tactics like bombings and massacres, but the Dwarves always find ways to tarnish it's image.

"As bad as you think I am, as far as you think I'm willing to go to protect that in which I hold dear -  you can't possibly fathom how deep that well of mine truly goes" - Alston

[Image](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/theweion/DnD_Campaign_Assets/main/Items/Alston/VoC_emblem.png)

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MfkEkdSZZRjWVv0rCY5_itemcontent
attribs.current: Photo of Alston's family during happier times, splashed in dry blood. Seems to hold sentimental value.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MgNSQpJ1gHOO4nbq2wG_itemcontent
attribs.current: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

abilities.name: Reload
abilities.action:
!ammo @{selected|character_id} repeating_resource_$1_resource_left +1 Depleted Energy Cell
!ammo @{selected|character_id} repeating_resource_$0_resource_left -1 Energy Cell
!ammo @{selected|character_id} other_resource [[-@{selected|other_resource}+@{selected|other_resource|max}]] energy cells
